instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SDA: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SDA? SMBUS_CHGR_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SCL: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SCL? SMBUS_CHGR_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message:
Hello,


I got this logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A. Minor water damage here and there, nothing crucial as it was working but not recognizing SSD. I ultrasoniced the board and the SSD and it works! Only issue, the battery is recognized but not charging. The battery itself is quite new, 11 load cycles so should not be the problem. History of the board is: was bought new 12 months ago, had a coffee spill after some weeks and has been in a drawer ever since.


Measured ISL resistance 17/18 26.80Ohm and 27/27 20.4Ohm.


Data lines on battery connector, diode mode


<SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SCL</SIGNAL>=0.500V

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SDA</SIGNAL>=0.500V


What do I measure next?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Resistance between 17 and 18 is high so thereâ€™s your problem. Most likely one or both resistors are blown for battery current sensing. Also make sure traces to ISL are good

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message:
Thank you JohnB8812, you were right. 

<RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> pin 2 was blown so I replaced the resistor and run a wire from pin 2 to a probe point near <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>. Nothing changed... So I decided to replace the ISL. Replacement ISL orientation and joints OK, as I put the board in the case and connected the battery, I heard a zap, there was a shortcut of some sort, even a hint of a smell of something burnt. 

So now I'm back at square one, having no light in the charger... Will get back to you as soon as I get it back.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message:
OK the wire I run from <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> (not <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>...) shorted with nearby <CAPACITOR>C7100</CAPACITOR> and that's what destroyed green light. Now I put a new ISL, run a new wire but now I get a green light flashing on and off every 1.5 second
if battery is connected, and steady green light if battery not connected. What could be the problem?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Check your resistance between pins 17 and 18 again it needs to be around 3.9 ohms. If not, therer is still something going on there. If so, what is the voltage on 3V42 and PPBUS with the battery plugged in?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Resistance 17/18 is 22 something MegaOhms! Checked <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>, both read OK. The wire I run from pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> to a probe point near <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> is clean. Tried new ISLs and a used one from a doner board. Same ridiculous high reading on 17/18. What am I doing wrong?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: You need to check the traces  from the ISL to those resistors and check the traces from this resistors back to the shunt resistor there is a break in the line somewhere.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Shunt resistor was out of specs and I used one from a late 13 retina. Now resistance 17/18 is 2.7Ohm but I still get a flashing green light...

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS with and without the battery? Voltage on 3v42 when the light is flashing?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: PPBUS with charger only 17.72V, with both fluctuating between 16.35 and 12.12V. 3v42 is reading 3.39V and steady while flashing green light. Is it OK to keep the shunt resistor from late 2013 Retina, although slightly different resistance?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Yes shunt is ok, but 17.72 is wayyyy too high! That sounds like <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted. Replace the ISL, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time and see what happens.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Getting there!... I replaced ISL <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, put it together, connected battery and now I'm getting a steady green light turning into orange within seconds! But, Mac does not power on. PPBUS is 12.96V. Without battery, PPBUS is 12.50V, I'm getting a chime but no image.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: 12.96 with the battery? That's a little high possibly the battery causing it tho. When you say no image can you see anything if you put a flashlight to the Apple?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Right, I meant no backlight. I made a stupid mistake! While putting the board back in the case, I did not see the camera cable and it got underneath it so something is shorted :(

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Ok does it turn on still with no backlight? If so, what voltage do you get on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> with the screen connected of course?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Good news first: battery is charging! OK <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 15.86V, should be 55V, shouldn't it?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Ok so for one good! Backlight on these I think should be around 30ish volts. 15.86 volts would suggest that the circuit isn't boosting properly. Check for backlight enable and PWM and go from there. I'm not as familiar with backlight circuit on Retinas, but I'm sure Duke and others on here are.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Def try a PRAM reset first and make sure the screen is known good 2015 13" LCD.

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: I use an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.pdf and .brd for this board, which is sub optimal. Are these 2015 retina files available for buying?

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Thank you for the offer, John! I just found and downloaded the files, was surprised how easy it was this time, got lucky I guess. Back to work, how do you measure backlight enable if it is underneath, as you have to connect the screen. Unless I am supposed to have a loose screen and battery to make this measurement...

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: How could that be? A solder blob between <RESISTOR>R7745</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7741</CAPACITOR>? Removed it, bam everything works! Thank you for your help. (Solved)

threads.title: [S|OLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A sees but does not charge battery
threads.message: Awesome good job!
